com.greystripe.sdk
Class GSFullscreenActivity

java.lang.Object
  android.content.Context
      android.content.ContextWrapper
          android.view.ContextThemeWrapper
              android.app.Activity
                  com.greystripe.sdk.GSFullscreenActivity
All Implemented Interfaces:
android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.content.ComponentCallbacks2, android.hardware.Camera.PictureCallback, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.LayoutInflater.Factory, android.view.LayoutInflater.Factory2, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, android.view.Window.Callback
public final class GSFullscreenActivity
extends android.app.Activity
implements android.hardware.Camera.PictureCallback

This class is not meant to be explicitly called by the developer.

To create and display a fullscreen ad, please instantiate FullscreenAd.

Constructor Detail

GSFullscreenActivity

public GSFullscreenActivity()
Method Detail

openCameraPreview

public void openCameraPreview(boolean front)
Open the camera preview base on current orientation of the screen and which camera is used. To provide smooth transition during orientation change, we need to lock the screen first then set the correct display orientation angle.

Parameters:
frontFacing - true: if we want to use front camera false: if we want to use rear camera

lockOrientation

public void lockOrientation()
Lock the current orientation of the screen

takeScreenshot

public void takeScreenshot()
Take a screenshot in fullscreen ad

onConfigurationChanged

public void onConfigurationChanged(android.content.res.Configuration newConfig)
We override onConfigurationChanged to detect any orientation changes. This method should not be used by developers.

Specified by:
onConfigurationChanged in interface android.content.ComponentCallbacks
Overrides:
onConfigurationChanged in class android.app.Activity

onBackPressed

public void onBackPressed()
We override onBackPressed to clean up after a video ad, if one was playing.

Overrides:
onBackPressed in class android.app.Activity

onPictureTaken

public void onPictureTaken(byte[] data,
                           android.hardware.Camera camera)
Called when image data is available after a picture is taken. The format of the data depends on the context of the callback and Camera.Parameters settings.

Specified by:
onPictureTaken in interface android.hardware.Camera.PictureCallback
Parameters:
data - a byte array of the picture data
camera - the Camera service object
